transcript.sentence: The film begins with the picture logo followed by a lamp hopping over to the letter I and picks ah the lamp hops on Top of it. Squish ing it down until it takes the place of it in the logo.
The pixar short film is called lifted. It opens to a small house in the middle of nowhere. And it is nighttime.
The bench on the patio, the house begins to swing.
The windmill moves side to side.
The next scene shows a young man asleep. There is a flash of blue light that suddenly shines in through his window.
The light is coming from a spaceship right outside his house.
The man begins to levity off his bed and towards the window.
He misses the window and crashes into the wall
and continues snoring.
He then moves away from the wall. And again, another failed attempt to reach the window hits the wall.
Inside the spaceship, there is a small green frog like creature that is the one attending to remove the man from his home. But it's failing to do so.
There is a hologram of the house next to him with a red light flashing on a loud noise ringing. Every time he misses, moving the man outside the window.
There is another green creature looking on seemingly testing the other creature on their abducting abilities.
He has a clipboard and 10, and he does not look impressed.
After marking him down another time, the smaller green alien signals to the larger one that he has got it this time.
The man levitate stored the window, but then it suddenly flung to the wall.
The noise indicating that he missed rings again.
The small alien considers his options on which button to push on after picking looks onto the larger alien, smiling, looking to get validation. This is the correct one.
The larger idiom looks unimpressed, not giving any valid.
The smaller alien then picks another one another one, sadly, looks on as he gets no validation.
He hopelessly pushes a button. The man slams into the roof.
The alarm sounds again.
The smaller green alien yells out in frustration, gets out of his chair, and swings his home in around, pushing all the buttons and throwing the helmet all around the room.
At one point, the man makes it out of the window, but because buttons are still being pushed,
goes back.
The little green alien hurriedly looks through a book, while the man is still being thrown around the room shown by the hologram in the spaceship.
That sounds the alarm.
The small green alien has.
The scene shows the man sleeping face down on the floor. The blue light gleams on him.
The man begins to levitate, propel towards the window
back first.
It seems as though he's about to make it out through the window, but he doesn't fit through the cracks.
The green alien pushes a button, and the man moved slightly. He continues to push it.
The man is squeezing through the window. He fidget with the button, and the man is pulled out through the window.
Instead of making it to the spaceship, he hits the tree outside his house and get stuck in it.
There's rustling in the trees and he gets unstuck.
He makes it to the spaceship and turned through a large circular opening at the bottom of it.
A small alien looks gleefully
will. The larger alien is still unimpressed.
Small avian looks on gleefully, the larger aliens still unimpressed,
smugly. The smaller alien. Let's go of the button.
The man falls out through the hole and back down.
Both aliens look on. As the man falls out. He almost reaches the ground
when the blue light shines on him and stops him as he is about.
The larger alien is about a push, another button, and the smaller alien attempts to reach that same button.
The larger alien pushes a smaller alien away in the chair.
The larger alien stretches out his hands and cracks his fingers about to get to work, pushing several buttons at a time.
The blue light carries the man back to his room, where things are being put back into place. Water is being poured into the cup and into the flower of aces f l and the manner gets tucked in.
The larger alien begins to drive off
on the spaceship, and the smaller alien next to him begins to sniffle.
Upset that he couldn't get the man in the spaceship,
the larger alien glances at him.
The larger union looks at him and feel sympathy for the smaller one. He tapped him on the helmet
and offers him the chance to drive the spaceship.
He accepts
and takes the wheel.
The spaceship floats up in the air and away from the house,
then suddenly falls back down onto the house.
The spaceship
manages to eventually
float back up,
taking a large part of the ground with it, and zooms off.
All that is left. Is the man sleeping on his bed surrounded by a large hole
credits roll.

audio_descriptions.notes:
The film begins with the Pixar logo followed by a lamp hopping over to the letter I in Pixar. The lamp hops on top of it. Squishing it down until it takes the place of it in the logo.

The Pixar short film is called Lifted. It opens to a small house in the middle of nowhere and it is nighttime.

The bench on the patio of the house begins to swing. The windmill moves side to side. 

The next scene shows a young man asleep. There is a flash of blue light that suddenly shines in through his window. 

The light is coming from a spaceship right outside his house.

The man begins to levitate off his bed and towards the window. 

He misses the window and crashes into the wall and continues snoring.

 He then moves away from the wall and again in another failed attempt to reach the window hits the wall.

Inside the spaceship there is a small green, frog like creature that is the one attempting to remove the man from his home but is failing to do so. 

(add extended)
There is a hologram of the house next to him With a red light flashing and a loud noise ringing every time he misses moving the man outside the window. 

(add extended)
There is another green creature looking on seemingly testing the other creature on their abducting capabilities. He has a clipboard in his hand and he does not look impressed.

After marking him down another time, the smaller green alien signals to the larger one that he has got it this time.

The scene jumps back to the man still levitating and seemingly about to go out the window but instead is suddenly flung to the wall.

The noise indicating the small alien missed again sounds.

The small alien considers his options on which button to push and after picking looks onto to the larger alien, smiling, looking to get validation that it is the corret button. The larger alien looks on still unimpressed and not giving any validation.

The smaller alien then picks another one in an attempt to see if the larger alien will give him some type of hint. When he doesn’t he sadly switches his finger from button to button in the hopes the larger alien will help.

The small alien realizes the other won’t help so it pushes the button. The man slams into the roof. The noise signaling he misses sounds again.

The smaller green alien yells out in frustration. Gets out of his chair and swings his helmet around. Pushing all the buttons and throwing the man al around the room. At one point the man makes it out of the window but because buttons are still being pushed goes back in.

The little green alien hurriedly looks through a book while the man is still being thrown around the room shown by the hologram in the spaceships that sounds the alarm. The small green alien has a revlelation.

 He begins to levitate and is propelled toward the window back first. It seems like the man is about to make it into the window but he doesn’t fit in through the window crack.

The green alien slightly pushes a button and the man moves slightly. He continues to push it and the man is squeezing through the window. He fidgets with the button and the man is pulled out the window.

Instead of making it to the spaceship he hits the tree outside his house and gets stuck in it. Theres rustling in the trees and he gets unstuck.

He makes it to the spaceship entering through a large circular opening at the bottom of it.

The small alien looks on gleefully the larger alien is still unimpressed.

Smugly the smaller alien lets go of the button and the man falls out through the hole and back down. 

Both aliens look on as the man falls out. He almost reaches the ground when the blue light shines on him and stops him right as he is about to hit the ground.

The larger alien with his butt still stuck on the chair pushes one of the buttons to save the man. The wheels on the chair are still rolling around.

The larger alien is about to push another button and the smaller green alien tries to reach over to push that button. 

The larger alien pushes the smaller alien away in the chair. The smaller alien rolls away.

The larger alien stretches out his hands and cracks his fingers about to get to work. Pushing several buttons at a time, serious facial expression does not change.

The blue light shines back into the mans room where all of the things that fell get put back in place. A cup and a flower vase all get picked back up and are placed back on the table next to his bed. The drawers all move back in place and a rocking chair goes back to its corner. A pitcher full of water pours itself into a glass and waters the flowers in the vase.
The man comes back into the window and gets tucked into bed. The blue light turns off.

The larger alien begins to drive off and the smaller alien next to him begins to sniffle, upset that he couldn’t get the man in the spaceship. The larger alien glances at him.

The larger alien looks at him and feels sympathy for the smaller one. He taps him on the helmet. 
 
And offers him the chance to drive the spaceship.

The spaceship floats up into the air and away from the house but then suddenly falls back down onto the house. The spaceship floats back upp taking a large of the ground with it and zooms off.

All that is left is the man sleeping on his bed surrounded by a large whole.

Credits roll.

result.title: Lifted - Pixar

(Sound and Score by Adam Crossley)
